00021 #ifndef __TBB_item_buffer_H
00022 #define __TBB_item_buffer_H
00023 
00025     //* tests for empty and so forth.  No mutual exclusion is built in.
00026     template <typename T, typename A=cache_aligned_allocator<T> >
00027     class item_buffer {
00028     public:
00029         typedef T input_type;
00030         typedef T output_type;
00031     protected:
00032         typedef size_t size_type;
00033         typedef std::pair< T, bool > item_type;
00034         typedef typename A::template rebind<item_type>::other allocator_type;
00035 
00036         item_type *my_array;
00037         size_type my_array_size;
00038         static const size_type initial_buffer_size = 4;
00039         size_type my_head;
00040         size_type my_tail;
00041 
00042         bool buffer_empty() { return my_head == my_tail; }
00043 
00044         item_type &item(size_type i) { return my_array[i & (my_array_size - 1) ]; } // may not be marked valid
00045 
00046         bool item_valid(size_type i) { return item(i).second; }
00047 
00048         void fetch_front(T &v) { __TBB_ASSERT(item_valid(my_head), "front not valid"); v = item(my_head).first; }
00049         void fetch_back(T &v) { __TBB_ASSERT(item_valid(my_tail-1), "back not valid"); v = item(my_tail-1).first; }
00050 
00051         void invalidate(size_type i) { __TBB_ASSERT(item_valid(i), "Item not valid"); item(i).second = false; }
00052         void validate(size_type i) { __TBB_ASSERT(!item_valid(i), "Item already valid"); item(i).second = true; }
00053 
00054         void invalidate_front() { invalidate(my_head); }
00055         void validate_front() { validate(my_head); }
00056         void invalidate_back() { invalidate(my_tail-1); }
00057 
00058         size_type size() { return my_tail - my_head; }
00059         size_type capacity() { return my_array_size; }
00060         bool buffer_full() { return size() == capacity(); }
00061 
00063         void grow_my_array( size_t minimum_size ) {
00064             size_type old_size = my_array_size;
00065             size_type new_size = old_size ? 2*old_size : initial_buffer_size;
00066             while( new_size<minimum_size )
00067                 new_size*=2;
00068 
00069             item_type* new_array = allocator_type().allocate(new_size);
00070             item_type* old_array = my_array;
00071 
00072             for( size_type i=0; i<new_size; ++i ) {
00073                 new (&(new_array[i].first)) input_type();
00074                 new_array[i].second = false;
00075             }
00076 
00077             size_t t=my_head;
00078             for( size_type i=0; i<old_size; ++i, ++t )
00079                 new_array[t&(new_size-1)] = old_array[t&(old_size-1)];
00080             my_array = new_array;
00081             my_array_size = new_size;
00082             if( old_array ) {
00083                 for( size_type i=0; i<old_size; ++i, ++t )
00084                     old_array[i].first.~input_type();
00085                 allocator_type().deallocate(old_array,old_size);
00086             }
00087         }
00088 
00089         bool push_back(T &v) {
00090             if(buffer_full()) {
00091                 grow_my_array(size() + 1);
00092             }
00093             item(my_tail) = std::make_pair( v, true );
00094             ++my_tail;
00095             return true;
00096         }
00097 
00098         bool pop_back(T &v) {
00099             if (!item_valid(my_tail-1)) {
00100                 return false;
00101             }
00102             fetch_back(v);
00103             invalidate_back();
00104             --my_tail;
00105             return true;
00106         }
00107 
00108         bool pop_front(T &v) {
00109             if(!item_valid(my_head)) {
00110                 return false;
00111             }
00112             fetch_front(v);
00113             invalidate_front();
00114             ++my_head;
00115             return true;
00116         }
00117 
00118     public:
00120         item_buffer( ) : my_array(NULL), my_array_size(0),
00121             my_head(0), my_tail(0) {
00122             grow_my_array(initial_buffer_size);
00123         }
00124 
00125         ~item_buffer() {
00126             if (my_array) {
00127                 for( size_type i=0; i<my_array_size; ++i ) {
00128                     my_array[i].first.~input_type();
00129                 }
00130                 allocator_type().deallocate(my_array,my_array_size); 
00131             }
00132         }
00133 
00134     };
00135 
00137     //* complete operation with pop_front(); use consume_front().  
00138     //* No synchronization built-in.
00139     template<typename T, typename A=cache_aligned_allocator<T> >
00140     class reservable_item_buffer : public item_buffer<T, A> {
00141     protected:
00142         using item_buffer<T, A>::buffer_empty;
00143         using item_buffer<T, A>::fetch_front;
00144         using item_buffer<T, A>::invalidate_front;
00145         using item_buffer<T, A>::validate_front;
00146         using item_buffer<T, A>::item_valid;
00147         using item_buffer<T, A>::my_head;
00148 
00149     public:
00150         reservable_item_buffer() : item_buffer<T, A>(), my_reserved(false) {}
00151     protected:
00152 
00153         bool reserve_front(T &v) {
00154             if(my_reserved || !item_valid(my_head)) return false;
00155             my_reserved = true;
00156             // reserving the head
00157             fetch_front(v);
00158             // invalidate the head, but don't commit until consume is called
00159             invalidate_front();
00160             return true;
00161         }
00162 
00163         void consume_front() {
00164             __TBB_ASSERT(my_reserved, "Attempt to consume a non-reserved item");
00165             ++my_head;
00166             my_reserved = false;
00167         }
00168 
00169         void release_front() {
00170             __TBB_ASSERT(my_reserved, "Attempt to release a non-reserved item");
00171             validate_front();
00172             my_reserved = false;
00173         }
00174 
00175         bool my_reserved;
00176     };
00177 
00178 #endif // __TBB_item_buffer_H
